roleset.name: use
roleset.note: EXERCISE-V NOTES: Comparison to 'use'. Member of VNcls rehearse-26.8. (from exercise.01-v)
EXERCISE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to exercise.01-v. Vn class rehearse-26.8. Framed by Katie. (from exercise.01-n)

example.name: exercise your rights
example.text: In addition, New York-based LIN would exercise its right to buy out for $1.9 billion the 55% equity interest of its partner, Metromedia Co., in a New York cellular franchise.
example.arg: its right to buy out for $1.9 billion the 55% equity interest of its partner, Metromedia Co., in a New York cellular franchise

example.name: exercise caution
example.text: The Ministry of International Trade and Industry is so concerned that it recently took the unusual step of urging [Japanese auto companies]-1 *trace*-1 to exercise caution in capital spending.

example.name: stranded modifier
example.text: [The rights, which expire Nov. 21,]-1 can be exercised *trace*-1 for $100 each.

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: the exercise of the power they have given the Fed
example.arg: of the power they have given the Fed

example.name: Also arg 1 (this is going to be the most common pattern)
Last arg 1 example
example.text: The exercise of my discretion under Florida law

example.name: the illusive arg 0
example.text: President Lee Teng-hui's exercise of such powers

roleset.name: athletics
roleset.note: EXERCISE-V NOTES: Comparison to 'work out'. Member of VNcls dress-41.1.1. (from exercise.02-v)
EXERCISE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to exercise.02-v. VN class dress-41.1.1. Framed by Katie. (from exercise.02-n)

example.name: joint exercise
example.text: joint military exercises between the two countries

example.name: both args
example.text: John exercises his upper body three times a week.
